name: places/ChIJrSwLjaD2wokRBn04HXDjBGg
formattedAddress: 728 W 181st St, Magaw Pl, New York, NY 10033, USA
adrFormatAddress: 728 W 181st St, Magaw Pl, New York, NY 10033, USA

editorialSummary.text: Colorful ice cream parlor chain known for its many flavors plus sorbet & yogurt.

originalText.text:
I've been to this location twice. The first time, they gave me a medium cup instead of the large I paid for, which I didn't notice until I got home.

The second time, I ordered a milkshake and asked three times for them to make sure they didn't overblend it. I literally said, "Please make it so thick that the milkshake barely goes through the straw." Instead of a thick shake, I didn't even get a normally thick one.

My shake was the consistency/thickness of straight milk that was so watered down I could barely even taste the flavor. If you're going to charge $8 for a shake it needs to be an actual shake and not barely flavored milk, especially when a customer expressly asks for it not to be blended a lot. My croissant was also ice cold. I won't be back.

text.text:

The second time, I ordered a milkshake and asked three times for them to make sure they didn't overblend it. I literally said, "Please make it so thick that the milkshake barely goes through the straw." Instead of a thick shake, I didn't even get a normally thick one.

My shake was the consistency/thickness of straight milk that was so watered down I could barely even taste the flavor. If you're going to charge $8 for a shake it needs to be an actual shake and not barely flavored milk, especially when a customer expressly asks for it not to be blended a lot. My croissant was also ice cold. I won't be back.

originalText.text:
Wow...their peanut butter ice cream is to die for! I also went back a second night for the coffee flavor...also amazing.

For the past few days I've been craving root beer floats! Not that cheap fast food joint that put in the pull down handle ice cream, but real hand scooped.
I decided to see if a B & R was near my work and Voila! Yelp has not steered me wrong.
I hop in may to start what was to be the junk food lunch of the week. Get over here, and when I ask do you have root beer floats, was met with a yes.. then a gasp! Oh no we ran out of root beer. BUT the lovely lady said if I get a root beer from the liquor store, which was a mere 2 stores down she would make it an only charge me for the ice cream!. How customer service was that! I thought that was great.
Off I go. so for 3.00 but the 85 cents I spent on the can of soda. I had a large cup of root beer float, with left over soda, and enough ice cream to make a second one when I got back to the office, but you know that was pretty much gone by the time I got back.
My definite spot for my ice cream fix during work hours.
Staff is super friendly and helpful and aren't afraid to think outside the box!

originalText.text: I went there to get ice cream but they were out of multiple flavors. I ended up leaving with nothing because their selection was so sparse.  You're better off getting something from a bodega; at least they'll have flavors.

text.text: I went there to get ice cream but they were out of multiple flavors. I ended up leaving with nothing because their selection was so sparse.  You're better off getting something from a bodega; at least they'll have flavors.

originalText.text: I personally love it! This is the only BR close to my job. I walk from my job over here to get myself an ice cream or milkshake. Love the staff ! Especially, the cute rico suave guy ;D haha

originalText.text: Always a fun interaction with the dunkin employees at this specific location.  Always super friendly and hard working. I appreciate the kindness.
